Alicloud-Research Intern

算法题 - Coding

  1. Give the dependency as follow (you could treat those as packages in golang), you need to implement three functions which are install, remove, list.

    a -> b, c

    b -> c, d

    c -> f

    e -> c

    g -> h

    pakage a requires package b and c, pakage b requires package c and d…

    For example

    • install(a) should print f,c,d,b,a
      • Explain: The system do not have any packages at the start. So install(a) would install all the packages which related to package a. And you should print the result in correct sequence.
    • remove(c) should print error
      • also need to print the result in the correct sequence.
    • remove(a) should print a,b,c,d,f
    • list() should print all the packages which are installed in the system.
    Code:
    package main
   
import (
	"fmt"
)
   
var (
  // use map to store all the exited dependencies
	nodeMap = map[string][]string{
		"a": {"b", "c"},
		"b": {"c", "d"},
		"c": {"f"},
		"e": {"c"},
		"g": {"h"},
	}
   
	// record node's in-degree
	// node means that the nodes have already installed in the system
	degreeMap = map[string]int{}
   
)
   
// check whether node has already been installed
func found(node string) bool {
	_, ok := degreeMap[node]
	return ok
}
   
// install node, and its dependency
func install(node string) {
	// init node's in-degree
	_, ok := degreeMap[node]
	if !ok {
		degreeMap[node] = -1
	} else {
		degreeMap[node] -= 1
	}
	fmt.Print("install ", node, " -> ")
	installHelper(node)
	fmt.Println("")
}
   
func installHelper(node string) {
	// update node's in-degree
	// since recursion, node's in-degree should plus 1 each time when call this function
	_, ok := degreeMap[node]
	if !ok {
		degreeMap[node] = 1
	} else {
		degreeMap[node] += 1
	}
   
	// check whether this node has dependency
	// if not, print and return
	depend, ok := nodeMap[node]
	if !ok {
		fmt.Print(node, ",")
		return
	} else {
		for _, n := range depend {
			// if its dependency not in the list (not be installed)
			// recursion
			if !found(n) {
				installHelper(n)
			} else {
				// update in-degree of its dependency node
				_, ok := degreeMap[n]
				if !ok {
					degreeMap[n] = 1
				} else {
					degreeMap[n] += 1
				}
			}
		}
		fmt.Print(node, ",")
	}
   
}
   
func remove(deleteNode string) {
	res := ""
	// if in-degree is 0, cannot be removed, return error
	inDegree, ok := degreeMap[deleteNode]
	if inDegree != 0 || !ok {
		fmt.Println("remove", deleteNode, "-> error")
		return
	}
   
	// helper list to store the nodes which in-degree is 0
	tempList := []string{deleteNode}
   	
	for len(tempList) != 0 {
		// get current node and remove it from helper list
		// since its in-degree is 0
		currentNode := tempList[0]
		tempList = tempList[1:]
		res = fmt.Sprintf("%s,%s", res, currentNode)
   	
		// update installed list
		delete(degreeMap, currentNode)
   	
		// find dependency of current node
		nodes, _ := nodeMap[currentNode]
   	
		// update in-degree of its dependency nodes
		for _, node := range nodes {
			tempDegree, _ := degreeMap[node]
			tempDegree -= 1
			degreeMap[node] = tempDegree
			// if in-degree is 0, add to helper list
			if tempDegree == 0 {
				tempList = append(tempList, node)
			}
		}
	}
   	
	fmt.Println("remove", deleteNode, "->", res[1:])
   
}
   
// print all the keys in the installed list
func list() {
	res := ""
	for k := range degreeMap {
		res = fmt.Sprintf("%s,%s", res, k)
	}
	if len(res) == 0 {
		fmt.Println("list ->", res[:])
	} else {
		fmt.Println("list ->", res[1:])
	}
}
   
func main() {
	install("a")
	remove("c")
	install("e")
	remove("e")
	list()
   
	// Test Case 1:
	/*
		install a -> f,c,d,b,a // order
		remove c -> error
		install e -> e
		remove e -> e
		list -> a,b,c,d,f // no order
	*/
   	
	// Output 1:
	/*
		install a -> f,c,d,b,a,
		error
		install e -> e,
		remove e -> e
		list -> d,a,b,c,f
	*/
   	
	// Test Case 2 :
	/*
		install b -> f,c,d,b
		install a -> a
		remove a -> a,b,c,d,f
		install g -> h,g
		remove e -> error
		list -> g,h
	*/
   	
	// Output 2:
	/*
		install b -> f,c,d,b,
		install a -> a,
		remove a -> a,b,c,d,f
		install g -> h,g,
		error
		list -> g,h
	*/
   
}
  2. Single elements in the array - leetcode
    Code:
    // array always like 1,1,2,2,5,6,6
   
func findUnique(nums []int) int {
  left, right := 0, len(nums) - 1
     
  return helper(nums, left, right)
}
   
func helper(nums []int, left, right int) int {
  // if only one element, return
  if left == right {
    return nums[left]
  }
     
  mid := left + (right - left) / 2
     
  // check left and right whether == mid
  // if mid is unique, return mid
  if nums[mid] != nums[mid-1] && nums[mid] != nums[mid+1]{
    return nums[mid]
  }
     
  if nums[mid] == nums[mid-1]{
    if len(nums[left:mid+1]) % 2 != 0 {
      // left odd
      return helper(nums,left,mid)
	} else {
      // right odd
      return helper(nums, mid+1, right)
    }
  }
     
  if nums[mid] == nums[mid+1]{
    if len(nums[left:mid]) % 2 != 0 {
      // left odd
      return helper(nums,left,mid-1)
	} else {
      // right odd
      return helper(nums,mid,right)
    }
  }
     
  // -1 means there is no unique exist
  return -1
}
